TextView.android:text: Issuance of Preliminary Subdivision Development Permit (PSDP)

The issuance of a preliminary subdivision development permit (PSDP), in accordance with RA 7279, Executive Order No. 648, Presidential Decree No. 957, Batas Pambansa Bldg. 220, and related implementing rules and regulations, is a critical step in the subdivision development process. This permit is a legal document that authorizes the preliminary planning and layout of a subdivision project. It ensures compliance with pertinent laws and regulations governing land subdivision, promoting orderly and sustainable urban development. Approval of preliminary subdivision plan will be valid only for a period of one hundred eighty (180) days from date of approval.
Investors, Partner Agencies, and Barangay Officials
1. Application Form duly accomplished (1 Original and Notarized Copy) \n2. Checklist of Requirements

3. Site Development Plan (Schematic Plan) at a scale ranging from 1:200 to 1:2,000 showing the proposed layout of streets, lots, parks and playgrounds and other features in relation to existing conditions in the area prepared, signed and sealed by any licensed and registered architect, environmental planner, civil engineer, or geodetic engineer (3 Copies)
4. Documents duly signed by licensed architect, engineer, environmental planner, or geodetic engineer (3 Copies):

• Vicinity map indicating the adjoining land uses, access as well as existing facilities and utilities at least within 500 meters from the property boundaries of the project, drawn to any convenient scale.\n\n• Topographic Plan to include the following:
• Survey Plan of the Lot(s) as described in Transfer Certificate of Titles (TCTs).
5. Certified True Copy of Title(s) and current Tax Receipt (3 Copies)
Registry of Deeds/ Municipal Treasurers Office
6. Right to Use or Deed of Right-of-Way for access road and other utilities when applicable, subject to just compensation for private land (3 Copies)
Department of Public Works and Highways
7. Right to Use or Deed of Right-of-Way for access road and other utilities when applicable, subject to just compensation for private land (3 Copies)
Department of Environment and Natural Resources – Mines and Geosciences Bureau (DENR-MGB)
1. Submit duly accomplished Application Form and the complete required documents to the receiving officer for initial assessment and verification and secure the Order of Payment.
1.1. Provide the logbook to the client
1.2. Receive and record the Application Form and the complete required documents
1.3. Review, assess, and evaluate the submitted documents
1.5. Issue the Assessment and Order of Payment
1.7. For non-conforming, Sangguniang Bayan or the Local Zoning Board of Appeal will conduct technical review
1.9. Approved the Preliminary Subdivision Development Permit (PSDP)
2. Pay the required fees at the Municipal Treasurer’s Office and secure Official Receipt
3. Claim the Preliminary Subdivision Development Permit (PSDP) at the Office of the Municipal Planning and Development Coordinator
3.1. Check the Official Receipt and record the transaction in the releasing logbook
3.2. Release the permit to the client
4. Accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) and drop in the Feedback Box
4.1. Request the client to accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) Form
Housing and Land Use Regulatory Board 2013 Schedule of Fees
1. Preliminary Approval and Location Clearance (PALC)/Preliminary Subdivision Development Plan (PSDP)
Additional Fee on Floor Area of Housing Permit
